Stalcraft is an amazing game, but like most MMOs, there is a lot of grinding. Sometimes, you could also get mugged by some random person because there is PVP outside of safe zones. It's still fun though if you have time to grind and don't care about a few annoying people trying to kill you here and there. 

It's not really pay to win, but some people get the Stalcraft premium, and so they always get the best rewards from the battle pass and such. I will say, however, that you can get max level loot, even without paying a dime.

The game is set in the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone, and there are 2 factions; the Bandits, (who really live up to their name) and the Stalkers. You can join either faction at the beginning of the game, and there are unique rewards for each one. There is a story, and there are quests, but I think the most fun part is just getting better and better gear and then playing PVP battles with others. You have to destroy mutants and enemy NPCs to acquire barter resources, which can then be used along with in-game money to trade for better loot. 

One major part of the game is also the different parts of the Zone. At first, you only travel around the South Zone, which is sort of the lower-tier/newbie part of the map, and then you can eventually go to the North Zone, where sweats and no-life binge players walk around in. If you want to search for more money or better artifacts, which are sort of like trinkets, and give you bonuses, then you may want to travel to Lyubech-3, Stillwaters, or the Labyrinth. These 3 places are often considered the hardest parts, and I wouldn't recommend you go to them until you have really good gear.

The quests, while I won't spoil them for you, have you ally with one of the Northern factions. They are: Mercenaries and Covenant, (both for former bandits) and Rise and Frontier. (both for former stalkers)
These 4 factions get very aggressive with each other. 

Anyways, it's free, so you might as well give it a try.

This Game is geally good so far ! 

[h2]Lore[/h2]

I started this game when Stlacker 2 released. I was hype by the lore, but I don’t play solo/PVE game. Stalcraft take the whole ambiance (mutants, anomalies, exclusion zone etc …) of stalker game. The Art Direction is nice, it didn’t feel like minecraft at all. 

[h2]Progression[/h2]

Progression est very nice ! This is the most important for me when starting a new game. The game offers a quest based progression as well as a grindy/farming progression style. But it’s not too much. If you compare, for instance, to Albion where you need weeks to unlock something, here the grind for an item won’t be more than 2 days (~6h).

[h2]PVE[/h2]

PVE will be challenging when you arrived in a new zone, but not too much. But you have to be ready to die from PVE and anomalies. 

[h2]PVP[/h2]
I love PVP in this game. It’s an open world, you can go everywhere, but it will take way more time to go to the other faction territory. So when farming/questing, if you stay on your side of the map, you will only encounter PVP 1 out of 10 raids. But if you want more action, you can farm in the enemy part of the map !
 
When you die you don’t lose your gear, you drop some valuable collected on your raid, but the most important resources stay in a bag, which is drop but can’t be opened by your enemy so they will either send it back for free or auction it.

[h2]End Game[/h2]
A lot of critiques concerns the end game, I’m not there yet with 80 hours, and honestly I have been enjoying the game so far. The early game if very nice, mid-game also ! Definitely worth giving it a try.

I've played the shit outta this game. Easily one of my most played games out there. It all went to shit. 

Don't waste your time. I've gotten myself outta this abusive relationship type game. Don't get yourself into it.

This game is a trap that catches you with a wide sprawling open world map, realistic gun animations, PVP/PVE interactions and loot/economy/gambling.

It used to be that you could level the battle pass infinitely by completing events around the map. They completely removed this feature as of the time I played this game. Now you are time gated behind a certain amount of season points per day that is completed by completing certain events around the map or session modes. I DO NOT LIKE THIS. Especially with whales existing who just buy the entire season pass in order to use the OP new addition to the game. Which brings me to my next point.

The entire game play loop once you get to late-end game is this: you join a clan or run solo, you run throughout the map and complete events, you run emission when it hits and compete for arties and you complete dailies to get the most out of your day. Oh, you can also hit up sessions which is ONLY for late game gamers and is filled to the brim with meta using gamers who follow the OP meta as close as they can to get the most kills, thus the most rewards. This is all well and good as long as there isn't an artificial meta curated by the developers in order to curry the most sales possible. Every new battlepass/ weapon balancing/ weapon addition makes an already existing weapon OP or adds a new weapon into the game that is OP. They do this in order to have people buy stalcoins in order to get the newest meta fastest so that who ever does is OP until they nerf said gun. They do this EVERY NEW EVENT. Said practice brings me to my next point.

Once you get to late game, the only three worth while things you can do outside of the event are clan war, still water and emissions. When there is no event to play through, you have to repeat these three things if you want to progress in late game properly. This gets boring and repetitive. So once you've played everything there is to play and everything to progress is STILL A MONTH OR MORE away and you have to do the same thing over and over again what else is there? There is the event. The events range from cancerous but rewarding to actually somewhat fun for the first few times but not really all that rewarding if you just do what you've already been doing for months. This creates a loop of doing the same shit over and over again getting the event going, then going back to the previous loop. I hated this at the 4th or so time around. Guess what? Once the event is over, you gotta wait more than a month for the next one to drop. All this waiting while dealing with clan drama, ultra sweat lords who you try and try to kill but they annihilate you all the same due to their skill, gear and experience and not having any new content to play through. Which brings me to my next point.

Most of the end game players are the best of the best. Not even joking. The player pool in NA is filled to the brim with people who have been playing for longer than I or are somewhat new to the north and are in the process of getting chewed up and spat out if without proper guidance. Adding this to the fact that most people at this point of the game are uber sweat lords with the inkling to hunt you down at the slightest peep outta you because they too are bored. With all this in mind, you being an average PVPer with a farming build on attempting to acquire your daily dues in order to progress so that you can keep up. Guess what? Now, in the latest patch of the game I was a part of, grouping up became a whole lot more main-stream. So much so, that if you are alone, you must be one of the best PVPers in the entire game in order to constantly kill a group of five mans as they continuously come back over again. "What about the clan of 30 or more guys you were a part of?" you may ask. Nope. Unreliable at best in terms of willingness to go out as a five stack to combat a five stack in order to just get some progression. Most of the clan members you may have been playing with for months if not more than a year are bored of the game at this point. Or are hyper focused on a certain action/activity in the game and are unwilling to go anywhere else or do anything else. You finally got yourself a five man? Were you finally successful in wiping those pesky players from your farming spot in still water? Watch out for third parties. Then fourth parties. Oh, the team you killed that was originally giving you trouble? They are back and you are probably down to one man at that point. This is all if you're lucky enough to get a team together anyways. Wanna try to avoid the hordes of people and try to play at night? Too bad, the game has no-lifers who are capable of playing from dawn to the early hours of the morning. Have fun with that.

Another problem I had with this game was the incorrigible balancing it had. You have a 9x39/9x19MM SMG? best in slot for within 6 meters. You got a 5.56x45/5.45x39/7.62x39/7.62x51/12.7/9X39 assault rifle? Close to long range but will still lose 80% of the time to either an SMG or a DMR/sniper rifle. You got a 7.62x51/7.62x54/12.7/9x39 sniper rifle/DMR? Wins at range but is useless at close range without support. Add this to the newest artifact changes which can heal you within a few seconds and wear any container on any suit and you got a bullet sponge game. You gotta shoot someone in the head 2-3 times in the head with even the heaviest sniper rifle (more with a DMR). You gotta do that 6-10 times in the head with assault rifles. With smgs? 6-15 times in the head depending. This turns combat into a slaughter fest of just shooting the same guy in the head multiple times while his friend and yours do the same while one party might run away/ do jumps and crouches to mix it up. I hated this. Oh, you got a fight you can't win and you've got a good build? Just walk away and out heal the bullets IMPACTING YOUR HEAD. I hated how survivable everyone felt. Including myself. 

Pair all of this with the fact that most of the people in this game are immature kids or adults with a whole lotta time on their hands but little people skills and you got yourself stuck in the middle, searching for a group to be a part of. Good luck finding a community you fit in with. I had that, until it all started falling apart. Nothing lasts forever. I just didn't outlast the game constantly changing itself into something I didn't enjoy. 

If you read all this and think "yeah, I like the sound of this" then I wish you the best fun. But in my opinion, Stalcraft hasn't had a properly good update in months.

I love this game. Or, rather, the idea of this game. Or, more specifically, what this game is, and has been as a new player, until getting to the end game where you really start to see between the lines. When all of the quests are done (mostly) and you're doing dailies and participating in seasonal stuff and battle passes, you really start seeing between the lines at the greed of the devs and how they continually screw with the game in ways that always make things more tedious for players and try to make them more money from boosters and pay-to-skip or pay-to-optimize.

The concept of a Stalker multiplayer game that's essentially an MMO with varied, respawning activities is really cool and was well-implemented. The new player experience was magic for me, and this game accomplishes something really special. It has great gun-play, and fantastic exploration and novelty of area, anomalies, gear, and a great progression system and a huge variety of quests that are mostly fun. It scratches the itch to a degree of a Tarkov-like extraction experience with the constant threat of PVP around the corner (but with mutants and anomalies too), but with way less actual punishment when you get ganked, and a really interesting solution of keeping some things, losing some things, and ultimately not suffering as much as it feels like you do when you lose a huge haul. Also there's a great player economy, and a lot of times, players just give you the important stuff back. At least, in the end game, they do.

But the devs.

The greed. The constant tweaking to make this a hamster wheel for the players and to chain us to the game every day if we want to get to the end of the battle pass or earn the special things. And every time they come up with ways to renovate systems, they present it as improvements, but secretly (or not so secretly), the new systems are designed to make players grind more for the same benefits. Unless you spend some cash to make it slightly less painful.

And it gets worse season after season. I've been playing this game for over a year, I have four characters in the end game (one in each faction), and I've grinded a lot with each of them, some more than others, season by season. And if I really think back over that year+, any improvements I come up with have also come with new chains, more tedium, and more grind. I'm sure the devs sit around and brainstorm ways to present new concepts to the players while also thinking that they'll make more income from this new pay-to-optimize thing, and that thing, and so on. Which is fine. Whatever. Capitalism. But it's just yet another wonderful game being ruined by greed.

This would be a fantastic game if the devs would get out of the way and stop pushing, pushing, pushing for us to have less fun and grind more. It's disgusting.

Stalcraft is great for PVE players who love Stalker, who are also patient enough to accept that PVP exists and you can eventually learn to rat around it. And it's also great for PVPers who love duking it out in arenas, or even hunting poor SOB's that are farming for builds and stealing their stuff. But I wouldn't recommend it unless you accept that it's probably going to continue to go downhill in player exploitation, or unless you accept that after finishing the excellent climb to end-game, you'll be broken-hearted eventually by the shady devs.

I want to know who came up with the designs for these bosses so I can make sure I never play anything made by them again.
